remarks.format: ## Remarks 当单击排序按钮 (其`CommandName`属性设置为 "Sort " 的按钮) 时,控件将引发事件,但在控件处理排序操作之前。The control raises the event when a Sort button (a button with its `CommandName` property set to "Sort") is clicked, but before the control handles the sort operation. 这使你可以提供一种事件处理方法, 该方法可在每次发生此事件时执行自定义例程, 如取消排序操作。This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as canceling the sorting operation, whenever this event occurs. > [!NOTE] > 尽管控件中其`CommandName`属性设置为 " Sort" 的任何按钮都将引发事件, 但排序按钮通常出现在控件的标题行中。Although any button within a control with its `CommandName` property set to "Sort" will raise the event, Sort buttons typically appear in the header row of a control. 对象传递给事件处理方法, 该方法允许您指定或确定排序表达式和排序方式以对控件进行排序。 A object is passed to the event-handling method, which allows you to specify or determine the sort expression and sort direction in which to sort the control. 若要确定排序表达式, 请使用属性。To determine the sort expression, use the property. 若要确定排序方向, 请使用属性。To determine the sort direction, use the property. 还可以通过将属性设置为来`true`取消排序操作。You can also cancel a sorting operation by setting the property to `true`. 有关如何处理事件的详细信息, 请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about how to handle events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). 有关实例的初始属性值的列表, 请参见构造函数。For a list of initial property values for an instance of , see the constructor. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用传递给事件处理方法的对象在用户尝试对控件中的 address 列进行排序时取消排序操作。The following example demonstrates how to use the object passed to the event-handling method to cancel the sorting operation when the user attempts to sort the address column in a control.
